DOC.brief_summary: The pilot study aim conduct randomize pilot trial sample 40 incarcerated woman lifetime interpersonal violence 6-10 week away release demonstrate feasibility acceptability propose recruitment method research design , intervention training method , deliver enhanced Women 's Coop nutrition control intervention . Per recent guidance NIMH , investigator also examine 95 % confidence interval around difference propose intervention dose-matched control condition ( Nutrition Program ) , follow outcomes 8 month post prison release : reduce unprotected vaginal anal sex occasion fewer case vaginal trichomoniasis ( primary ) ; reduce interpersonal violence episode , symptom PTSD depression , drug using/heavy drinking day ( secondary ) ; increase affect management social support ( include effectiveness obtain substance use , mental health treatment resource ) ( tertiary ) .
DOC.brief_title: HIV/STI Risk Reduction Incarcerated Women With Interpersonal Violence
DOC.criteria: Females prison Experienced lifetime interpersonal violence ( include physical sexual assault abuse ) At least one unprotected sexual occasion male partner within 90 day prior incarceration Approximately 610 week release Expect release location within RI MA Exclusion criterion : Can complete intake interview due problem reality test , brain impairment , language barrier
